title: Clock, first half of 20th century
inscribed:
on clock face: MAPPIN & WEBB/MADE IN FRANCE
on works: R   A    Asquilles FRANCE 10 Aiq le reveil
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Wiesenberger
description:
a)Traveling alarm clock, rectangular in plan, gilded bronze with bevelled glass panels, top and sides, exposing works. Handle on top. Horizontal banding of beading and acanthus leaves, female sheathed figures at four corners. b) Rectangular black leather case lined with red velvet, silk and paper. c) double-ended key for which storage slot is provided in case.

Donor mentions word "Heberlin" in connection with this clock.

tombstone.epitaph:
Clock, first half of 20th century.
first half of 20th century. 15 x 11.4 x 11 cm (5 7/8 x 4 1/2 x 4 5/16 in.). Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Wiesenberger. 1967-66-26-a/c.
